DataElement.preferredName: Notification Administration Performed Study Activity Negation Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action within the context of a given study that represents the communication of a message to a recipient. Specifies whether an activity did not occur. EXAMPLE(S): If a subject did not take aspirin in the previous week, the negation indicator = "true". NOTE(S): If it is important to capture the fact that a particular activity did not occur, then this attribute is used, often along with negation reason.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Notification Administration Performed Study Activity Negation Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Informing by words.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Negation is an operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true. The indicator usually takes the form of a single binary digit, or bit (either 0 or 1). (from Dictionary of Computers)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
